content:
• Thursday, August 23, 2012
  • SLH

    Solera Holdings (NYSE:SLH): Q2 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.30. Revenue of $198M (+8.8% Y/Y) beats...

    Solera Holdings (NYSE:SLH): Q2 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.30. Revenue of $198M (+8.8% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) advisers are asking potential buyers to bid for the entire business, even...

    Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) advisers are asking potential buyers to bid for the entire business, even as several suitors have inquired about individual parts of the grocery company, Bloomberg reports. Cerberus Capital is said to be looking at a possible deal involving the Albertsons unit, among other deals. SVU +6.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • ADSK

    More on Autodesk's FQ2: The CAD software leader blames "execution challenges" and macro issues...

    More on Autodesk's FQ2: The CAD software leader blames "execution challenges" and macro issues for the soft results. In response, the company is undergoing a restructuring that includes job cuts and $50M-$60M worth of charges. Autodesk expects FQ3 revenue of $550M-$570M and EPS of $0.40-$0.45, below a consensus of $601.2M and $0.50. It also expects 4%-6% FY13 revenue growth, below a 9.7% consensus. Deferred revenue +3% Q/Q to $752M. ADSK -22.4% AH. (PR) (CC webcast) (prepared remarks - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRM

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ2: Deferred revenue balance reached $1.34B, up 43% Y/Y but less than...

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ2: Deferred revenue balance reached $1.34B, up 43% Y/Y but less than 1% Q/Q and likely disappointing some. Unbilled deferred revenue +4% Q/Q to $2.8B. Free cash flow was $106.9M, soundly above non-GAAP net income of $60.7M and a GAAP net loss of $9.8M. Americas revenue +28% Y/Y (69% of total), Europe +22% (17%), Asia-Pac +29% (14%). Sales/marketing expenses +34% Y/Y and 52% of revenue. CRM -4.8% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • QEP

    QEP Resources (NYSE:QEP) signs agreements with multiple sellers to acquire crude oil development...

    QEP Resources (NYSE:QEP) signs agreements with multiple sellers to acquire crude oil development properties in North Dakota's Williston Basin for an aggregate purchase price of ~$1.38B. Aggregate current net production is ~10,500 boe/day. QEP +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • MCRS

    Micros Systems (NASDAQ:MCRS): FQ4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $302.5M (+10.4% Y/Y)...

    Micros Systems (NASDAQ:MCRS): FQ4 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $302.5M (+10.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN): FQ4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $139.2M (+22% Y/Y)...

    Aruba Networks (NASDAQ:ARUN): FQ4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $139.2M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +9.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q2 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $569M (+4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q2 EPS of $0.48 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $569M (+4% Y/Y) misses by $24M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • AB

    AllianceBernstein (AB +4%) is raised to Outperform with a $16 price target lifted from $14.50 by...

    AllianceBernstein (AB +4%) is raised to Outperform with a $16 price target lifted from $14.50 by Credit Suisse, which says AB's increased sales of higher-fee fund products remain underappreciated. The firm sees net flows, already improving, turning positive in Q4. AB trades at a discount to peers and investor sentiment is low, so the firm expects it to outperform over the next six months.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +3.2%) pushes higher following a report that it could be on the cusp of...

    First Solar (FSLR +3.2%) pushes higher following a report that it could be on the cusp of grabbing 20% of India's photovoltaic module market in expanding its role as a supplier. FSLR is making a bet that building plants and selling the power would be wiser than trying to compete with Chinese firms on panel prices which have slid 47% over the last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN +3.4%) spikes higher once again today on takeover chatter involving Sanofi (SNY...

    Regeneron (REGN +3.4%) spikes higher once again today on takeover chatter involving Sanofi (SNY -1%). A spokesperson for the company declined to comment, on any takeover talks, noting that the two companies have a solid working relationship and have stated it would be advantageous to keep the relationship going as it is now, as separate companies. SNY is currently REGN's largest shareholder, with a standstill agreement in place that prevents SNY from acquiring more than 30% of REGN.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • BIG

    Execs with Big Lots (BIG -23.1%) had the task of explaining away the retailer's sluggish sales...

    Execs with Big Lots (BIG -23.1%) had the task of explaining away the retailer's sluggish sales outlook on an earnings CC (transcript). They said that the expected decline in the retailer's gross margin rate is a function of a higher markdown rate and merchandise mix pressure as its discretionary businesses remain challenged in the fall season. The election season is also a worry, with management finding it a tough period to stoke up sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • VALE

    Brazil's national development bank approves 3.88B reais ($1.9B) in financing for Vale (VALE...

    Brazil's national development bank approves 3.88B reais ($1.9B) in financing for Vale (VALE -3.6%) to expand its transport infrastructure in the Brazil states of Maranhao and Para, where the company's massive Carajas iron ore mine is located. But investors are unmoved, sending shares lower as iron ore prices tumble on slower Chinese economic growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT -2.4%) shares weaken further after BHP's move to delay a final decision to build its...

    Potash (POT -2.4%) shares weaken further after BHP's move to delay a final decision to build its Jansen potash mine project. Scotia says the BHP delay was widely expected, and investors are more concerned over declining utilization rates by potash marketer Canpotex and Belarusian Potash's brownfield projects starting up over the next three years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT (HCN -1.7%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at UBS on the back of its...

    Health Care REIT (HCN -1.7%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral at UBS on the back of its acquisition of Sunrise Senior Living yesterday. The firm cites the near-term mechanics of the deal and the pressure it will put on operating leverage, plus the potential overhang from a possible equity offering. The deal was an expensive one for HCN, who paid a 62% premium to Sunrise's closing price on Tuesday - marking a level it hasn't traded at in nearly four years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD +5.9%) rally off of the company's Q2 earnings surprise and...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD +5.9%) rally off of the company's Q2 earnings surprise and minor boost in profit guidance. A healthy 5.4% gain in comparable-store sales was the headliner of the report, while moderating expenses also helped to lift results. On an earnings CC (transcript), execs note that concerns over commodity inflation has prompted the firm to already purchase flour and shortening for the first half of next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • BPR

    General Growth Properties (GGP +9%) soars as Bill Ackman's Pershing Square (with a 10% stake)...

    General Growth Properties (GGP +9%) soars as Bill Ackman's Pershing Square (with a 10% stake) demands the company put itself up for sale. Pershing (as it reminds the board in its letter) famously began buying into the then bankrupt mall-owner in 2008 at $0.25/share and led its restructuring.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • HEI

    Heico (HEI +10%) gains despite posting a mixed FQ3, beating on a per share basis but coming up...

    Heico (HEI +10%) gains despite posting a mixed FQ3, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Net profit rose 13% Y/Y however, as the aircraft parts and repair company recorded stronger sales from its electronic-technologies business, marking its tenth consecutive quarter of sales growth. Gross margins also widened to 37.3% from 35.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • SAND

    Sandstorm Gold (SAND -10.3%) shares sink after its previously announced deal financing is...

    Sandstorm Gold (SAND -10.3%) shares sink after its previously announced deal financing is increased to C$130M from C$75M. Lead underwriter Cormark Securities and others agree to purchase, on a bought deal basis, 13.05M units at C$10/unit for gross proceeds toward SAND.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLLR

    DFC Global (DLLR -8%) takes a hit after its FQ4 missed the mark late yesterday. Net earnings...

    DFC Global (DLLR -8%) takes a hit after its FQ4 missed the mark late yesterday. Net earnings swung to a loss as an impairment charge weighed on bottom-line results and revenue grew less than expected. The company also issued disappointing guidance for FY13, now expecting to earn between $2.35 - $2.55 per share. Wall Street expectations were for an EPS of $2.52.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • FRED

    Fred's (FRED -9.4%) Q2 earnings beat on the top line as net income rose 19% on a benefit from an...

    Fred's (FRED -9.4%) Q2 earnings beat on the top line as net income rose 19% on a benefit from an income tax settlement, which partially offset store closing costs and promotional markdowns. But the company lowered the bottom end of its FY12 EPS guidance by a penny, and warned of an "intensely" competitive retail environment in the third and fourth quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -4.9%) dives for the second time this week (previous) following a downgrade to Hold...

    Baidu (BIDU -4.9%) dives for the second time this week (previous) following a downgrade to Hold from Deutsche. The firm predicts Baidu will lose share to Qihoo's (QIHU -3.4%) new search engine due to the latter's giant web browser user base (272M users, or 51% of China's Internet base, according to Qihoo), and the "reasonably good user experience" of Qihoo's engine. But is that engine making use of Baidu's IP and/or search data?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 6 Comments
  • ANH

    Anworth Mortgage (ANH +1.6%) gets an upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee. No details yet on the...

    Anworth Mortgage (ANH +1.6%) gets an upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee. No details yet on the reasoning, but the it seems clear with the firm reporting BV of $7.19/share as of June 30 vs. the shares closing at $6.63 last night. The company's entire portfolio consists of agency MBS, 78% of which is adjustable rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • WMGI

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI -1%) slips after pricing its $260M offering of convertible senior...

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI -1%) slips after pricing its $260M offering of convertible senior notes due 2017. The Company plans to use approximately $130M of the net proceeds to repay its outstanding term loan under its senior credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +4.7%) is trading at levels last seen during the Dot.com bubble after...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +4.7%) is trading at levels last seen during the Dot.com bubble after Barclays starts coverage on the iPhone/iPad audio codec supplier with an Overweight. Meanwhile, Skyworks (SWKS +2.2%) is benefiting from a bullish note from BofA: the firm sees the next iPhone, Samsung's Galaxy S III, growing sales of 4G phones (require more costly RF components), and a Sep. 20 analyst day giving the chipmaker a lift.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +2.5%) says one of its global engineering and construction subsidiaries is...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +2.5%) says one of its global engineering and construction subsidiaries is awarded a contract by Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) for a grassroots gas-to-chemicals complex in Brazil. FWLT will provide basic engineering design, front-end engineering design, and technical assistance and training throughout plant performance testing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -3.5%) has bought bankrupt Solyndra's giant Fremont, CA manufacturing plant. It's...

    Seagate (STX -3.5%) has bought bankrupt Solyndra's giant Fremont, CA manufacturing plant. It's unwknown whether Seagate, currently based out of nearby Scotts Valley, plans to make the building its new HQ, use it for hard drive assembly, or both. Shares are selling off today in response to H-P's weak PC sales data, and so are those of rival Western Digital (WDC -2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • LANC

    Lancaster Colony (LANC +3.5%) trades up after the maker of specialty foods, automotive products,...

    Lancaster Colony (LANC +3.5%) trades up after the maker of specialty foods, automotive products, glassware and candles easily beat FQ4 expectations. Total revenue rose 7% Y/Y on an 8% rise in net sales from its specialty foods segment. Higher pricing contributed over 2% of the sales growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems (QSII -4.9%) elects two directors nominated by dissident board member Ahmed...

    Quality Systems (QSII -4.9%) elects two directors nominated by dissident board member Ahmed Hussein, and seven of the eight nominees named by the company, amid a long-running proxy battle. The board has not yet divulged which one of Mr. Hussein's nominees was elected, but the dissident shareholder had been pushing hard for former Microsoft executive John McDuffy to become the company's chairman if his slate of directors was elected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • FXE

    Rumors about a Spanish bailout - including ECB bond buys - aren't enough to move the needle...

    Rumors about a Spanish bailout - including ECB bond buys - aren't enough to move the needle on stocks, but do send the euro hurtling higher by nearly 50 pips. Old habits die hard. FXE +0.5%. Shares in Madrid remain lower by 1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • PDCO

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -4.6%) slips after its FQ1 bottom line missed estimates this morning....

    Patterson Companies (PDCO -4.6%) slips after its FQ1 bottom line missed estimates this morning. Net earnings edged down 2.2% on higher interest expenses related to its employee stock plan and margins that weakened to 33.5% from 34.4%, masking strong sales growth in its dental-equipment and software segments. Veterinary sales were up 13%, while sales in its smaller rehabilitation-supply unit improved by 3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX +5%) pops on a UBS upgrade to Buy on valuation. UBS thinks the stock has been...

    Luminex (LMNX +5%) pops on a UBS upgrade to Buy on valuation. UBS thinks the stock has been oversold recently on the back of its dilutive acquisition GenturaDx, plus negative press over its Biowatch sensors. The investment bank said in a note to clients it sees multiple expansion through launches, and that a high percentage of recurring revenues and a focus on clinical markets "makes for a favorable profile amidst macro challenges.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • WBMD

    Beaten-down WebMD (WBMD -2.9%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond...

    Beaten-down WebMD (WBMD -2.9%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James. WebMD, a Carl Icahn target, announced this morning it has hired healthcare industry vet David C. Marek to oversee its consumer sites.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -3.2%) is reduced to Underperform with a $20 target at Sterne Agee, which...

    Ultra Petroleum (UPL -3.2%) is reduced to Underperform with a $20 target at Sterne Agee, which calls shares overvalued and cites a muted outlook for natural gas in 2013. UPL is waiting for prices of $5/million BTUs to accelerate production, a scenario Sterne doesn’t foresee any time soon; the firm also says UPL may issue equity to fund a near-term liquids growth opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHU

    China Unicom (CHU +7.1%) jumps after reporting a Q2 net profit of CNY2.42B ($381M), slightly...

    China Unicom (CHU +7.1%) jumps after reporting a Q2 net profit of CNY2.42B ($381M), slightly better than analyst estimates. China's #2 carrier also reported 1H mobile service revenue rose 23.4% Y/Y, and that it ended June with 219.2M total subscribers and 57.5M 3G subscribers. ARPU rose 2.8% Y/Y to CNY48.1 ($7.57). (CHA results)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • AKS

    U.S. steel producers are downgraded by Dahlman Rose, which thinks the next move in steel prices...

    U.S. steel producers are downgraded by Dahlman Rose, which thinks the next move in steel prices will be lower. "Recent domestic price increases have not been matched internationally, potentially inviting increased imports later this year and placing a de facto ceiling on domestic prices," the firm says. AK Steel (AKS -4.7%) is cut to Sell from Hold. Cut to Hold from Buy: MT, NUE, STLD, X.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV -4.0%) trail off after the company loses out on a lush DOD contract....

    Shares of Navistar (NAV -4.0%) trail off after the company loses out on a lush DOD contract. Company officials say they are disappointed on losing out on working to create a new Humvee prototype, but see an opportunity to compete for a production contract after development is completed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -8.6%) plunges after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Credit Suisse....

    Adtran (ADTN -8.6%) plunges after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Credit Suisse. Shares have already been pressured this year by poor earnings and telecom capex concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +3.9%) jumps higher following reports that Korea Gas has formed a consortium with...

    InterOil (IOC +3.9%) jumps higher following reports that Korea Gas has formed a consortium with Mitsui and Japan Petroleum Exploration to participate in IOC's $5.4B LNG project in Papua New Guinea.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD -2.3%) is making new multi-year lows in response to HP's FQ3 report, adding to...

    Dell (DELL-OLD -2.3%) is making new multi-year lows in response to HP's FQ3 report, adding to the bludgeoning the company saw yesterday due to its own earnings report. Other PC-related names are also lower: INTC -1.7%. MSFT -1.3%. AMD -2.2%. The consumer and enterprise receptions to Windows 8, which has received very mixed (I, II) initial reviews, are now more important than ever.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 15 Comments
  • JAGGF

    Silver leaps 3.5%, gold gains 1.6% and crude oil rises to just under $98 as traders try to crowd...

    Silver leaps 3.5%, gold gains 1.6% and crude oil rises to just under $98 as traders try to crowd ahead of anticipated Fed stimulus. “If they keep teasing - like Pavlov’s dogs, traders keep trying to run in front of the announcement,” ICAP’s Kenneth Polcari writes. JAG +3.8%, GOLD +2.6%, AG +2%, PAAS +1.9%, EGO +1.8%, SVM +1.5%, SLW +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 10 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -6.5%) opens with a thud after posting an FQ3 report that featured major top-line...

    H-P (HPQ -6.5%) opens with a thud after posting an FQ3 report that featured major top-line weakness (especially in PCs). A downbeat earnings call didn't help either. Needham provides a list of problems that includes "a PC business struggling to find a place in the new tablet/ultrathin world while fighting off bottom-feeders," and the "lemon Autonomy acquisition." Sterne Agee is more positive, pointing out H-P trades at 4x estimated 2013 EPS, and lowered net debt by $3B in FQ3. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • AAV-OLD

    Advantage Oil and Gas (NYSE:AAV-OLD) +10.3% premarket after announcing it has engaged RBC...

    Advantage Oil and Gas (NYSE:AAV-OLD) +10.3% premarket after announcing it has engaged RBC Capital to attempt to sell all non-core assets. AAV believes the move will simplify the company, leading to a greater appreciation of its core Glacier Montney natural gas asset and generate proceeds that may be used for debt repayment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • GES

    The global expansion of Guess (NYSE:GES) remains a work in progress after disasterous results in...

    The global expansion of Guess (NYSE:GES) remains a work in progress after disasterous results in southern Europe and brands that didn't click in the U.S. dragged down its Q2 results (I, II). Analysts warn that a fashion refresh for Guess' popular lines may be needed to recharge customers. Shares of GES -18.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM

  • Market preview: It was all looking so dandy earlier on, when joyous dreams of more Fed and...

    Market preview: It was all looking so dandy earlier on, when joyous dreams of more Fed and Chinese easing sent global stocks skipping higher with delight. But comments from that party pooper James Bullard - he even spoke about rate hikes - and slightly disappointing jobless claims seem to have sent shares scuttling. S&P benchmark -0.15%. H-P -5.8% following its earnings report. Later: New Home Sales, FHFA House Price Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • HAIN

    Premarket gainers: HAIN +12%. SNPS +8%. LOGI +7%. Losers: GES -18%. BIG -17%. HPQ -6%.

    Premarket gainers: HAIN +12%. SNPS +8%. LOGI +7%.
    Losers: GES -18%. BIG -17%. HPQ -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SWY

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) declares $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) declares $0.175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 4.38%. For shareholders of record Sep 20. Payable Oct 11. Ex-div date Sep 18. Shares -1.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • HTZ

    Will the marriage finally happen? Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) reaches out to Dollar Thrifty...

    Will the marriage finally happen? Hertz Global (NYSE:HTZ) reaches out to Dollar Thrifty (NYSE:DTG) shareholders to hash out a selling price, according to sources. If the report pans out, it may be an indication that regulatory hurdles are all but cleared to see the long-standing courtship progress. Some bullish analysts see a deal going off at in the $85-$90 range for Dollar Thrifty, currently shares of DTG +4.1% premarket to $78.84.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • CAG

    Ralcorp (RAH +3.85%) looks set for investor agitation after hedge fund Corvex discloses that it...

    Ralcorp (RAH +3.85%) looks set for investor agitation after hedge fund Corvex discloses that it has upped its stake in the company to 5.1% and says Ralcorp should enhance stockholder value in one of three ways: a sale, an M&A with another food company, or with a "self-help" strategy with new board directors. Ralcorp was the subject of ConAgra's advances in 2011 but rebuffed them.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +15% to $5.44) flies after Aegis Capital initiates coverage of the...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +15% to $5.44) flies after Aegis Capital initiates coverage of the shares with a "buy" rating and gives them an eye-catching price target of $16. Shares also spiked sharply on Monday after Rosetta announced management hires.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • TTC

    Toro (NYSE:TTC): FQ3 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $504M (+0.6% Y/Y) misses by $22M....

    Toro (NYSE:TTC): FQ3 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $504M (+0.6% Y/Y) misses by $22M. Shares -4.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • ACOM

    Shares of Ancestry.com (NASDAQ:ACOM) gain 9.4% in premarket trading after the company stirs the...

    Shares of Ancestry.com (NASDAQ:ACOM) gain 9.4% in premarket trading after the company stirs the pot by asking potential suitors to raise their buyout offers. Though shares have run up 38% over the last few months as the company opened itself up for bids, revenue projections have also shot higher to keep valuations somewhat reasonable for a high-growth Internet name.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • BIG

    Shares of Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) crater, moving down 20.6% premarket after the retailer slashes its...

    Shares of Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) crater, moving down 20.6% premarket after the retailer slashes its EPS guidance. Though the Big Lots management takes on criticism from analysts on expense control after a 1.9% drop in comparable-store sales led to a 33% dropoff in operating profit, it looks like heads are already rolling with the firm announcing a slew of organizational changes earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE), which yesterday closed at $0.38, receives notice from Nasdaq that it will...

    A123 Systems (AONE), which yesterday closed at $0.38, receives notice from Nasdaq that it will be delisted from the exchange unless its share price recovers to $1 and stays there for 10 consecutive business days within the next six months. A123's shares have suffered due to its worsening cash position following a battery recall and slow demand. Shares +5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM | 6 Comments
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) +1.6% premarket after reporting FQ4 net investment income of...

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) +1.6% premarket after reporting FQ4 net investment income of $0.51/share +66% Y/Y and vs. FQ4 distributions of $0.30. NAV of $10.83, +0.09% Q/Q, +4.5% Y/Y. FQ4 new portfolio investments of $573M, bringing total portfolio to $2.1B. Annualized current yield on investments of 13.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM | 6 Comments

  • Gold continues to party as the weak Chinese PMI print overnight combines with yesterday's...

    Gold continues to party as the weak Chinese PMIprint overnight combines with yesterday's FOMC minutes to give rise to the idea of a lot more fiat paper chasing the same level of goods. The yellow metal (along with silver) has clearly broken through key technical levels as well. GLD +0.5%, SLV +1.6% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 AM | 5 Comments

  • EU shares are higher in early trading as markets think happy thoughts about Fed easing after the...

    EU shares are higher in early trading as markets think happy thoughts about Fed easing after the FOMC minutes yesterday and from China following its PMI data. And could the Europeans make it triple-play stimulus after their PMI shows continued contraction? Euro Stoxx 50 +0.5%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.5%, Frankfurt +0.6%, Madrid +0.3%, Milan +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 AM

  • Asian markets are higher following the FOMC's strong indication that more easing is on the way...

    Asian markets are higher following the FOMC's strong indication that more easing is on the way and China's depressing PMI reading, which may also have increased the chances of stimulus in the country. Japan +0.5%, Hong Kong +1%, China +0.3%, India +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 AM
